American women writers]] [[Category:DeBartolo family]] [[Category:Novelists from California]] [[Category:Novelists from Ohio]] [[Category:Screenwriters from Ohio]] {{US-novelist-1970s-stub}}

{{distinguish|Holy Trinity Episcopal Church (Manhattan)}} {{Infobox NRHP | name =Trinity Church and Graveyard | nrhp_type =nhl | image =Trinity Church NYC 004b.JPG | caption =Trinity Church from Wall Street | location=75 Broadway
[[Manhattan]], [[New York City]] | coordinates = {{coord|40|42|29|N|74|0|44|W|display=inline,title}} | locmapin = United States Manhattan#New York#USA | map_label =Trinity Church | area = | built =1839–1846{{cite nycland}}, p. 11 | architect= [[Richard Upjohn]] | architecture= Gothic Revival | designated_nrhp_type= December 8, 1976,{{cite web|url=http://tps.cr.nps.gov/nhl/detail.cfm?ResourceId=1648&ResourceType=District|title=Trinity Church and Graveyard|date=2007-09-11|work=National Historic Landmark summary listing|publisher=National Park Service|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071229092359/http://tps.cr.nps.gov/nhl/detail.cfm?ResourceId=1648&ResourceType=District|archivedate=2007-12-29|df=}} | added = December 8, 1976{{NRISref|2007a}} | governing_body = Private | refnum=76001252 | designated_other2_name = NYC Landmark | designated_other2_date = August 16, 1966 | designated_other2_abbr = NYCL | designated_other2_link = New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission | designated_other2_number = | designated_other2_color = #ffe978 }} '''Trinity Church''' is a historic [[parish]] church in the [[Episcopal Diocese of New York]] located near the intersection of [[Wall Street]] and [[Broadway (Manhattan)|Broadway]] in the lower Manhattan section of [[New York City]], [[New York (state)|New York]]. Known for both its location and endowment,{{cite news|title=Trinity Church Split on How to Manage $2 Billion Legacy of a Queen|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2013/04/25/nyregion/trinity-church-in-manhattan-is-split-on-how-to-spend-its-wealth.html|accessdate=April 25, 2013|newspaper=The New York Times|date=April 24, 2013|author=Otterman, Sharon}} Trinity is a traditional [[high church]], with an active parish centered around the [[Episcopal Church (United States)|Episcopal Church]] and the worldwide [[Anglican Communion]] in missionary, outreach, and fellowship. == History and architecture == The Trinity Church has been significant to New York City's history for over 300 years. In 1696, [[Benjamin Fletcher|Governor Benjamin Fletcher]] approved the purchase of land in Lower Manhattan by the [[Church of England]] community for construction of a new church. The parish received its charter from [[William III of England|King William III]] on May 6, 1697. Its land grant specified an annual rent of 60 bushels of wheat.{{cite news| url=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1859/11/18/78901567.pdf | work=The New York Times | title=TRINITY CHURCH PROPERTY.; Outline of the Legal History of the Trinity "Church Farm." | date=November 18, 1859}} The first rector was [[William Vesey]] (for whom nearby [[Vesey Street]] is named), a protege of [[Increase Mather]], who served for 49 years until his death in 1746. ===First Trinity Church=== [[File:Charles Inglis by Robert Field.jpg|thumb|left| [[Loyalist (American Revolution)|Loyalist]] [[Charles Inglis (bishop)|Charles Inglis]], Rector of Trinity Church (1765–1783)]] The first Trinity Church building, a modest rectangular structure with a [[gambrel roof]] and small porch, was constructed in 1698, on [[Wall Street]], facing the [[Hudson River]]. The land on which it was built was formerly a formal garden and then a burial ground.{{cite web |url= http://www.ekamper.net/gr-misc.htm |title= Digital redraft of the Castello Plan of New Amsterdam in New Netherland in 1660 [Beta] |access-date= 2017-05-16}}{{cite web |url= http://patricia.rootsweb.ancestry.com/nytristate/castello.htm |title= INDEX TO PLOTS ON THE CASTELLO PLAN MAP |website= Ancestry.com |access-date= 2017-05-16}}{{cite web |url= https://www.lib.utexas.edu/maps/historical/new_york_1695.jpg |title= New York City 1695 | website= University of Texas Libraries |access-date= 2017-05-15}} It was built because in 1696, members of the [[Church of England]] (Anglicans) protested to obtain a "charter granting the church legal status" in New York City. According to historical records, [[William Kidd|Captain William Kidd]] lent the runner and tackle from his ship for hoisting the stones.{{cite web|url=http://www.trinitywallstreet.org/about/history/ |title= Historical Timeline |website=TrinityChurch.org}}{{cite web | url=http://www.trinitywallstreet.org/news/blogs/the-archivists-mailbag/question-of-the-day-trinitys-very-own-pirate | title=Question of the Day: Trinity's Very Own Pirate? | publisher=Trinity Church | work=The Archivist's Mailbag | date=November 19, 2008 | accessdate=December 18, 2011}} [[Anne, Queen of Great Britain]], increased the parish's land holdings to {{convert|215|acre|m2}} in 1705. Later, in 1709, [[William Huddleston]] founded [[Trinity School (New York)|Trinity School]] as the [[Charity School]] of the church, and classes were originally held in the steeple of the church. In 1754, King's College (now [[Columbia University]]) was chartered by [[George II of Great Britain|King George II of Great Britain]], and instruction began with eight students in a school building near the church. During the [[American Revolutionary War]] the city became the British military and political base of operations in North America, following the departure of General [[George Washington]] and the [[Continental Army]] shortly after [[Battle of Long Island]] and subsequent local defeats. Under British occupation clergy were required to be [[Loyalist]]s, while the parishioners included some members of the revolutionary [[New York Provincial Congress]], as well as the [[First Continental Congress|First]] and [[Second Continental Congress]]es. The church was destroyed in the [[Great New York City Fire of 1776]], which started in the Fighting Cocks Tavern, destroying nearly 400 to 500 buildings and houses, and leaving thousands of New Yorkers homeless. Six days later, most of the city's volunteer firemen followed General Washington north. Rev. [[Charles Inglis (bishop)|Charles Inglis]] served throughout the war and then to Nova Scotia on evacuation with the whole congregation of Trinity Church.[https://archive.org/stream/loyalismnewyork00flicrich#page/36/mode/1up/search/nova+scotia Loyalism in New York during the American revolution, p. 36] The [[Samuel Provoost|Rev. Samuel Provoost]] was appointed Rector of Trinity (1784–1800) in 1784, and the New York State Legislature ratified the charter of Trinity Church, deleting the provision that asserted its loyalty to the King of England. [[Patriot (American Revolution)|Whig]] patriots were appointed as vestrymen. In 1787, Provoost was consecrated as the first Bishop of the newly formed Diocese of New York. Following his 1789 inauguration at Federal Hall, George Washington attended [[Thanksgiving]] service, presided over by Bishop Provoost, at [[St. Paul's Chapel]], a chapel of the Parish of Trinity Church. He continued to attend services there until the second Trinity Church was finished in 1790. St. Paul's Chapel is currently part of the Parish of Trinity Church and is the oldest public building in continuous use in New York City. ===Second Trinity Church=== Construction on the second Trinity Church building began in 1788; it was consecrated in 1790. St. Paul's Chapel was used while the second Trinity Church was being built. The second Trinity Church was built facing Wall Street; it was 200 feet tall, and longer and wider than its predecessor. Building a bigger church was beneficial because the population of New York City was expanding. The church was torn down after being weakened by severe snows during the winter of 1838–39. The second Trinity Church was politically significant because President Washington and members of his government often worshiped there. Additional notable parishioners included [[John Jay]] and [[Alexander Hamilton]].{{citation needed|date=November 2017}} {{multiple image | align = right | direction = horizontal | image1 = Trinity Church Bird's Eye View New York City 1846.jpg | width1 = 205 | caption1 = Bird's-eye view of Trinity Church, 1846 | image2 = TrinityChurchView1872.jpg | width2 = 187 | caption2 = View from church steeple, 1872 }} [[File:Detroit Photographic Company (0708).jpg|thumb|300px|Trinity Church ca. 1900]] ===Third Trinity Church=== The third and current Trinity Church began construction in 1839 and was finished in 1846. When the Episcopal Bishop of New York consecrated Trinity Church on [[Ascension Day]] (May 1) 1846, its soaring [[Gothic Revival]] spire, surmounted by a gilded cross, dominated the skyline of lower Manhattan. Trinity was a welcoming beacon for ships sailing into [[New York Harbor]]. In 1843, Trinity Church's expanding parish was divided due to the burgeoning cityscape and to better serve the needs of its parishioners. The newly formed parish would build [[Grace Church, New York|Grace Church]], to the north on Broadway at 10th street, while the original parish would re-build Trinity Church, the structure that stands today. Both Grace and Trinity Churches were completed and consecrated in 1846. Trinity Church held the title of [[tallest building in the United States]] until 1869, when it was surpassed by [[St. Michael's Church, Old Town, Chicago]]. At the time of its completion, Trinity's {{convert|281|ft|m|adj=on}} spire and cross comprised the highest point in New York, until it was surpassed in 1883 by the stone tower of the [[Brooklyn Bridge]], and in 1890 by the [[New York World Building]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.trinitywallstreet.org/|title=Trinity Church|website=trinitywallstreet.org|access-date=2016-11-17}} In 1876–1877 a [[reredos]] and altar were erected in memory of [[William Backhouse Astor, Sr.]], to the designs of architect [[Frederick Clarke Withers]]. Architectural historians consider the third and present Trinity Church building, built in 1846 and designed by architect [[Richard Upjohn]], the first and finest example of Gothic Revival architecture.{{Cite web |url=https://www.trinitywallstreet.org/ |title=Trinity Church |website=Trinity Church|access-date=2016-11-17}} In 1976 the [[United States Department of the Interior]] designated Trinity Church a [[National Historic Landmark]] because of its architectural significance and its place within the history of New York City.{{cite web |url={{NHLS url|id=76001252}} |title=National Register of Historic Places Inventory-Nomination |date=August 1976 |publisher=National Park Service}}{{cite web |url={{NHLS url|id=76001252|photos=y}} |title=National Register of Historic Places Inventory-Nomination (photos) |date=August 1976 |publisher=National Park Service}} ===Trinity today=== On July 9, 1976, [[Elizabeth II|Queen Elizabeth II]] and [[Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh]] visited Trinity Church. Vestrymen presented the Queen with a symbolic "back rent" of 279 [[peppercorns]]. Since 1993, Trinity Church has hosted the graduation ceremonies of the [[High School of Economics and Finance]]. The school is located on [[Trinity Place]], a few blocks away from the church. Guided tours of the church are offered daily at 2 p.m.{{citation needed|date=January 2017}} ====September 11, 2001==== During the [[September 11 attacks]], people took refuge inside the church from the massive debris cloud produced by the first World Trade Center tower collapse. Some of the chapel pew's paint was rubbed off from the people taking refuge.{{Cite news |url=https://www.trinitywallstreet.org/blogs/moment/pilgrimage-ground-zero-and-beyond |title=Pilgrimage to Ground Zero, and Beyond |date=2011-09-09|work=Trinity Church |access-date=2018-04-08|language=en}} The pews were later replaced, but one still exists at the back of the chapel for remembrance of the events on 9/11. Falling wreckage knocked over a giant [[sycamore]] tree that had stood for nearly a century in the churchyard of [[St. Paul's Chapel]], part of Trinity Church's parish, located several blocks north of Trinity Church. Sculptor [[Steve Tobin]] used its roots as the base for a bronze sculpture titled ''Trinity Root'', which stood in front of the church at the corner of [[Wall Street]] and [[Broadway (Manhattan)|Broadway]] until December 2015 when it was moved by the church to its conference center in Connecticut. The move was controversial as it damaged the sculpture, which was later repaired, and the artist has objected to its eviction.{{cite news |work=The New York Times |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/07/07/nyregion/artist-still-in-shock-after-trinity-church-uproots-and-breaks-his-9-11-work.html |title=Artist still in shock after Trinity Church uproots and breaks his 9/11 work|date=July 6, 2016}} ====Occupy Wall Street==== Trinity is located near [[Zuccotti Park]], the location of the [[Occupy Wall Street]] protest. It offered both moral and practical support to the demonstrators but balked when church-owned land adjoining [[Juan Pablo Duarte Square]] was demanded for an encampment. For withholding this property the church hierarchy were criticized by others within the Anglican movement, most notably Archbishop [[Desmond Tutu]].{{cite news|title=Occupy Group Faults Church, a Onetime Ally|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2011/12/17/nyregion/church-that-aided-wall-st-protesters-is-now-their-target.html |accessdate=December 17, 2011 |newspaper=The New York Times|date=December 16, 2011|author=Matt Flegenheimer}} On December 17, 2011, occupiers, accompanied by a few clergy, attempted to occupy the land (known as [[LentSpace]]), which is surrounded by a [[chain-link fence]]. After demonstrating in Duarte Park and marching on the streets surrounding the park, occupiers climbed over{{cite news|title=Re-Occupy: A Movement Seeks a Sanctuary: On occupying Trinity Church—and the Occupy movement's relationship with established institutions |url=http://www.yesmagazine.org/people-power/reoccupy-a-movement-seeks-a-sanctuary |accessdate=December 31, 2011 |newspaper=Yes!|date=December 19, 2011|author=Nathan Schneider}} and under the fence. Police responded by arresting about 50 demonstrators, including at least three Episcopal clergymen and a Roman Catholic nun.{{cite news |title=Arrests as Occupy Protest Turns to Church |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2011/12/18/nyregion/occupy-wall-street-protesters-march-against-trinity-church.html |accessdate=December 18, 2011 |newspaper=The New York Times |date=December 17, 2011 |author=Al Baker|author2=Colin Moynihan}} == Burial grounds == {{main|Trinity Church Cemetery}} There are three [[burial grounds]] closely associated with Trinity Church: #[[Trinity Church Cemetery|Trinity Churchyard]], at Wall Street and Broadway, is where [[Alexander Hamilton]], [[Elizabeth Schuyler Hamilton]], [[Angelica Schuyler Church]], [[Philip Hamilton]], [[William Bradford (1663-1752)|William Bradford]], [[Franklin Wharton]], [[Robert Fulton]], Captain [[James Lawrence]], [[William Alexander, Lord Stirling]], [[Francis Lewis]], and [[Albert Gallatin]] are buried. #[[Trinity Church Cemetery|Trinity Church Cemetery and Mausoleum]] on [[Riverside Drive (New York)|Riverside Drive]] at 155th Street, formerly the location of [[John James Audubon]]'s estate, is where [[John James Audubon]], [[Alfred Tennyson Dickens]], [[John Jacob Astor]], and [[Clement Clarke Moore]] are buried. It is the only active cemetery remaining in the borough of Manhattan. #The [[St. Paul's Chapel|Churchyard of St. Paul's Chapel]] is where memorials to the United Irishmen Addis Emmet and Dr. William MacNeven are located. == Bells == The tower of Trinity Church currently contains 23 [[Church bell|bell]]s, the heaviest of which weighs 27 U.S. [[hundredweight]] (1225 kg). Eight of these bells were cast for the tower of the second church building and were hung for ringing in the English [[change ringing]] style. Three more bells were added later. In 1946 these bells were adapted for swing chiming and sounded by electric motors. A project to install a new ring of 12 additional [[change ringing]] bells was initially proposed in 2001 but put on hold in the aftermath of the [[9/11]] attacks, which took place three blocks north of the church. This project came to fruition in 2006, thanks to funding from the [[Dill Faulkes|Dill Faulkes Educational Trust]]. These new bells form the first ring of 12 change-ringing bells ever installed in a church in the United States. The installation work was carried out by [[John Taylor Bellfounders|Taylors, Eayre and Smith]] of [[Loughborough]], England, in September 2006. In late 2006, the ringing of the bells for bell practice and tuning caused much concern to local residents, some of whose windows and residences are less than 100 feet at eye level from the bell tower. The church then built a plywood deck right over the bells and placed shutters on the inside of the bell chamber's lancet windows. With the shutters and the plywood deck closed, the sound of the bells outside the tower is minimal. The shutters, and hatches in the plywood deck, are opened for public ringing. Public ringing takes place before and after 11:15 a.m. Sunday service and on special occasions, such as 9/11 commemorations, weddings, and ticker-tape parades. Details of the individual bells can be found at Dove's Guide for Church Bellringers.{{cite web|url=http://www.cccbr.org.uk/dove/detail.php?DoveID=NEW+YORK12 |title=Dove's Guide for Church Bellringers|website=cccbr.org.uk}} [[Image:NYC Trinity Church.jpg|thumb|300px|Interior of Trinity Church]] == Doors == Trinity Church has three sets of impressive bronze doors, donated by [[William Waldorf Astor, 1st Viscount Astor]] in memory of his father, [[John Jacob Astor III]]. Conceived by [[Richard Morris Hunt]], they date from 1893 and were produced by [[Karl Bitter]] (east door), [[J. Massey Rhind]] (south door), and [[Charles Henry Niehaus]] (north door). The north and east doors each consists of six panels from Church history or the Bible, and the south door depicts the history of New York in its six panels.Craven, Wayne, Sculpture in America, Thomas Y. Crowell Co., New York 1968, p. 454 == Services == Trinity Church, as an Episcopal parish in the [[Anglican Communion]], offers a full schedule of Daily Prayer and [[Eucharist]] services throughout the week, and based on the [[Book of Common Prayer]]; it is also available for special occasions, such as weddings and baptisms. In addition to daily worship, Trinity Church provides Christian fellowship and outreach to the community. Sunday * 8am: St. Paul's Chapel, Low Eucharist * 9am: Trinity Church, Holy Eucharist with music ([https://www.trinitywallstreet.org/videos Webcast]) * 9:15am: St. Paul's Chapel, Family Eucharist * 11:15am: Trinity Church, Solemn Eucharist ([https://www.trinitywallstreet.org/videos Webcast]) * 8pm: St. Paul's Chapel, Compline by Candlelight Monday–Friday * 8:15am: Morning Prayer * 9:00am: Morning Prayer * 12:05pm: Holy Eucharist ([https://www.trinitywallstreet.org/videos Webcast]) * 5:15pm: Evening Prayer Thursday *5:15pm: Evensong ==Music and arts== Trinity Church has a rich music program with an annual budget of $2.5 million as of 2011. ''Concerts at One'' has been providing live professional classical and contemporary music for the Wall Street community since 1969, and the church has several organized choirs, featured Sunday mornings on [[WQXR-FM|WQXR 105.9 FM]] in New York City. Trinity presents world-class music programs both in New York City and around the world via high definition video streaming. The mainstay of Trinity's music program is The Choir of Trinity Wall Street, a professional ensemble that leads liturgical music at Trinity Church and St. Paul's Chapel, presents new-music concerts in New York City, produces recordings, and performs in international tours. The Choir is often joined by the Trinity Baroque Orchestra, Trinity's ensemble of period instrumentalists, and NOVUS NY, Trinity's contemporary music orchestra. Trinity is also home to a Youth Chorus, Youth Orchestra, Family Choir, Downtown Voices, change bell ringers, and a wide variety of arts programming through Congregational Arts. Visiting choirs from around the world perform at Trinity weekly. The entire music program is under the leadership of [[Julian Wachner]], Director of Music and the Arts, a renowned conductor, composer, and keyboard artist. == Property holdings == [[File:Closeuptrinity.jpg|thumb|Close-up of statues of Trinity Church]] Beginning in the 1780s, the church's claim on 62 acres of Queen Anne's 1705 grant was contested in the courts by descendants of a 17th-century Dutchwoman, Anneke Jans Bogardus, who, it was claimed, held original title to that property. The basis of the lawsuits was that only five of Bogardus' six heirs had conveyed the land to the English crown in 1671.{{cite news| url=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1879/05/07/80751664.pdf | work=The New York Times | title=A Dutchwoman's Farm.; The Hon. James W. Gerard On The Anneke Jans Bogardus Claims | date=May 7, 1879}} Numerous times over the course of six decades, the claimants asserted themselves in court, losing each time. The attempt was even revived in the 20th century. In 1959, the [[Internal Revenue Service]] sued over the compensation of the church's property manager, but the church prevailed in ''[[Stanton v. United States]]''. Disclosure resulting from a lawsuit filed by a parishioner revealed total assets of about $2 billion as of 2011. Although Trinity Church has sold off much of the land that was part of the royal grant from Queen Anne,{{cite inside}}, pp.22-23 it is still one of the largest landowners in New York City with 14 acres of Manhattan real estate including 5.5 million square feet of commercial space in [[Hudson Square]].{{cite web|url=http://www.trinitywallstreet.org/about/real-estate|title=Trinity Real Estate|publisher=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091130021304/http://www.trinitywallstreet.org/about/real-estate|archivedate=2009-11-30|df=}} The parish's annual revenue from its real estate holdings was $158 million in 2011 with net income of $38 million, making it perhaps one of the richest individual parishes in the world. The institution also owns the [[Trinity Court Building]] property, where it formerly housed its offices and preschool. That building was demolished in 2015, and a replacement is under construction.{{Cite news|url=https://newyorkyimby.com/2016/10/new-mixed-use-tower-revealed-at-74-trinity-place-financial-district.html|title=New Mixed-Use Tower Revealed at 74 Trinity Place, Financial District - New York YIMBY|date=2016-10-24|work=New York YIMBY|access-date=2018-03-15|language=en-US}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.6sqft.com/construction-kicks-off-on-trinity-churchs-pelli-clarke-pelli-designed-community-center-and-office-tower/|title=Construction kicks off on Trinity Church's Pelli Clarke Pelli-designed community center and office tower {{!}} 6sqft|website=6sqft|language=en-US|access-date=2018-03-15}} The church was connected to the previous building by a footbridge, which was preserved during demolition, and will be connected to the new building upon its completion. == Staff == '''Clergy''' * The Rev. Dr. William Lupfer (''Rector'') * The Rev. Phillip A. Jackson (''Vicar'') * The Rev. Winnie Varghese (''Dir. of Justice & Reconciliation'') * The Rev. Dr. Mark Francisco Bozzuti-Jones (''Dir. of Core Values and Latin America & Caribbean Relations'') * The Rev. Canon Benjamin Musoke-Lubega (''Dir. of Anglican Relations'') * The Rev. Kristin Kaulbach Miles (''Dir. for Pastoral Care and Community'') * The Rev. Frank Hakoola (''Program Officer for Africa'') * The Rev. Elizabeth Blunt (''Dir. for Congregational Life and the Arts'') * The Rev. Daniel Simons (''Dir. of Spiritual Formation & Pilgrimage'') * The Rev. C. Alfred Loua (''Priest for Pastoral Care & Community'') * The Rev. Bruce W. B. Jenneker (''Priest and Director of Liturgy'') * The Rev. Canon James G. Callaway (''Deputy Emeritus and Priest Associate'') * The Rev. Clayton D. Crawley (''Priest Associate'') * The Rev. Robert F. Herrick (''Priest Associate'') '''Lay''' * Ellen Andrews (''Program Manager, Pastoral Care & Community'') * Sister Promise Atelon (''Sisters of Saint Margaret'') * Melissa Attebury (''Associate Director of Music'') * Wendy Claire Barrie (''Program Manager for Children & Youth'') * Dr. Kathy Bozzuti-Jones (''Associate Director of Faith Formation & Education'') * Jennifer Chinn (''Program {{Infobox musical artist <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Musicians --> | name = Ulf Ekberg | image = Ulf Ekberg.jpg | caption = Ulf Ekberg in December 2012 | image_size = | background = solo_singer | birth_name = Ulf Gunnar Ekberg | alias = Buddha | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1970|12|6}} | birth_place = [[Gothenburg]], [[Sweden]] | death_date = | origin = | instrument = [[Keyboard instrument]], [[voice]] | genre = [[Pop music|Pop]] | occupation = [[Keyboardist]], [[songwriter]], [[singer]], [[businessman]], [[television producer]], [[film producer]] | years_active = 1983–present | label = | associated_acts = [[Ace of Base]] | website = }} '''Ulf Gunnar Ekberg''' (born December 6, 1970), also known as '''Buddha''', is a Swedish singer-songwriter, musician, businessman and television and film producer, best known as a founding member of the pop group [[Ace of Base]], along with siblings [[Jonas Berggren]], [[Linn Berggren]] and [[Jenny Berggren]].
==Life and career==
Ace of Base released its debut album in 1992 and went on to attain major chart success throughout the 1990s.
Ekberg has [[record producer|produced]] several artists, TV productions, films and events and has sold over 40 million records world wide.{{citation needed|date=April 2013}}
Ulf restarted Ace of Base in 2006, touring the world with them from 2007 to 2009. In 2009, he started a new music production/publishing and management company together with Jonas Berggren based in LA, London and Stockholm.{{citation needed|date=April 2013}}
After Ekberg experienced the [[tsunami]] in [[Phuket Province|Phuket]], Thailand, he founded the Surin Relief Fund to support affected children by providing facilities to educate children and care for orphaned children.<ref>[http://www.surinrelieffund.com Surinrelieffund.com] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071008205422/http://www.surinrelieffund.com/ |date=2007-10-08 }}</ref>
===Neo-Nazi activities=== In its 27 March 1993 edition, the Swedish [[newspaper]] ''[[Expressen]]'' reported that Ekberg had once been a member of a band called "Commit Suiside" [''[[sic]]''], which sang songs with explicit racist lyrics.<ref name="vice">http://noisey.vice.com/blog/ace-of-bases-secret-nazi-past</ref> Ekberg claims that the cited lyrics were not recorded by Commit Suiside, but says he regrets this past part of his life as a big mistake.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/04/24/ace-of-base-nazi-past-lyrics_n_3148797.html | work=Huffington Post | title=Ace of Base Responds To Nazi Allegations | date=24 April 2013}}</ref> Commit Suiside was a neo-Nazi band active in Gothenburg from 1983 to 1986, when Ulf was between the ages of 13 and 16. Other media outlets reported that Ekberg had been a neo-nazi [[skinhead]].<ref>[http://jam.canoe.ca/Music/Artists/A/Ace_Of_Base/2005/08/24/1186511.html Toronto Sun: Swedish stars holding Aces]</ref><ref name="BostonPhoenix">[http://weeklywire.com/ww/05-08-00/boston_music_4.html The Boston Phoenix: How Swede It Is]</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Jag är på väg ut ur mörkret|date=17 June 1998|newspaper=Aftonbladet|author=Jörgen Holmstedt|url=http://wwwc.aftonbladet.se/noje/9806/17/ulfekberg.html|language=Swedish}}</ref> In 1988 he was a part of the leadership of the [[Sweden Democrats]] in [[Gothenburg]].<ref>{{cite book|title=[[Sverigedemokraterna: den nationella rörelsen]] |last1=Larsson |first1=Stieg |authorlink1=Stieg Larsson |authorlink2=Mikael Ekman |year=2001 |publisher=[[Ordfront]] |location= |isbn=91-7324-877-0 |page=111 }}</ref> In 1998 some of his old songs were released on the compilation album ''Uffe was a Nazi!''. Including songs like ''Rör inte vårt land'' (Don't touch our land), ''Vit makt, svartskalleslakt!'' (White Power, black head slaughter) and a cover of [[Skrewdriver]]'s "Smash the IRA", with the lyrics changed to refer to the [[Left Party (Sweden)|VPK]].<ref name="vice" />
In the 1997 documentary ''Our Story'', Ekberg said: "I told everyone I really regret what I've done. I closed that book. I don't want to even talk about it, that time does not exist in me any more. I closed it and I threw the book away 1987. I took the experience from it, I learned from it. But that life is not me. It's somebody else."
===Personal life=== Ekberg dated the Swedish model/actress [[Emma Wiklund|Emma Sjöberg]] from 1994 to 2000. He currently lives in [[London]] with his girlfriend Johanna Aybar and their three children: Viggo, Vincent and Valentina.
==Writing==
Ekberg has written and produced the following songs:
===With Jonas Berggren=== * "Wheel of Fortune" * "All That She Wants" * "Young and Proud" * "Living in Danger" * "My Mind" * "Dancer in Daydream" * "Happy Nation" * "Voulez-Vous Danser" * "Waiting for Magic" * "Münchhausen (Just Chaos)" * "Blah, blah, blah on the Radio" * "Southern California" * "One Day" * "Doreen" * "Precious" * "Black Sea" * "Vision in Blue" * "Who am I" * "Told My Ma"
===With Jonas, Jenny, & Malin Berggren=== * "Hear Me Calling" * "Love In December" * "Change With the Light"
===With StoneStream & John Ballard=== * "Que Sera" * "Perfect World" * "Edge of Heaven" * "Look Around Me" (Unreleased) * "Angel of Love" (Unreleased)
===With John Ballard=== * "Mercy Mercy" * "I Pray" * "Don't Go Away"
===With Jonas Berggen & [[Jonas Saeed]]=== * "All For You" * "The Golden Ratio"
===With Jonas Berggren, Ari Lehtonen & D. Massy=== * "Mr Replay"
==Vocals== Ekberg has contributed vocals to the following songs: * "All That She Wants" * "Wheel of Fortune" * "Living in Danger" * "My Mind" * "Happy Nation" * "Don't Turn Around" * "Waiting for Magic" * "Fashion Party" * "Münchhausen (Just Chaos)" * "Hear Me Calling" * "Perfect World" * "I Pray" * "Change With the Light" * "Mr. Replay"
==References== {{reflist}}

{{Use dmy dates|date=April 2016}} {{Infobox person |name=Umberto Agnelli |image= Umberto Agnelli and Antonella Piaggio 1960 Olympics.jpg |imagesize= 250px |caption = Umberto Agnelli with wife Antonella Piaggio at the 1960 Olympics |birth_date={{birth date|df=yes|1934|11|1}} |birth_place=[[Lausanne]], [[Switzerland]] |death_date = {{death date and age|df=yes|2004|5|27|1934|11|1}}
[[Piedmont]], [[Italy]] |occupation=Head of [[Fiat]] and [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] |nationality = [[Italy|Italian]] |salary= |parents = [[Edoardo Agnelli (industrialist)|Edoardo Agnelli]]
[[Virginia Bourbon del Monte]] |spouse=Antonella Bechi Piaggio (divorced)
Allegra Caracciolo di Castagneto |children=Giovanni Alberto Agnelli
[[Andrea Agnelli]]
Anna Agnelli }} '''Umberto Agnelli''' (1 November 1934 – 27 May 2004) was an [[Italy|Italian]] [[industrialist]] and [[politician]]. He was the third son of [[Virginia Agnelli]] (born Donna Virginia Bourbon del Monte) and of [[Edoardo Agnelli (industrialist)|Edoardo Agnelli]], and the youngest brother of [[Gianni Agnelli]]. He served as a [[chief executive officer|CEO]] of Italian carmaker [[Fiat]] from 1970 to 1976{{cite news|url=http://news.independent.co.uk/people/obituaries/article38565.ece|title=Umberto Agnelli|accessdate=31 December 2007|work=news.independent.co.uk|location=London|date=29 May 2004|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071219150336/http://news.independent.co.uk/people/obituaries/article38565.ece|archivedate=19 December 2007|df=dmy-all}} and, on the death of his brother Gianni, was briefly chairman of the FIAT Group, 2003–2004, until his own death, aged 69, the following year. He was also chairman and {{fact span|text=later honorary chairman|date=April 2017}} of [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]], the football team long-associated with FIAT and the [[Agnelli family]], and was for a time the president of the Italian Football Association. He was a [[Italian Senate|senator]] of the [[Italian Republic]], from 1976 to 1979. In 2015, he was posthumously inducted into the [[Italian Football Hall of Fame]].{{cite web|url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/27-10-2015/hall-of-fame-vialli-mancini-facchetti-ronaldo-herrera-agnelli-tardelli-ferlaino-130676725232.shtml|title=Hall of fame, 10 new entry: con Vialli e Mancini anche Facchetti e Ronaldo|trans-title=Hall of fame, 10 new entries: with Vialli and Mancini also Facchetti and Ronaldo|publisher=La Gazzetta dello Sport|language=Italian|date=27 October 2015|accessdate=27 October 2015}} ==Career== [[File:Gianni e Umberto Agnelli, 1965 - san dl SAN IMG-00001296.jpg|thumb|Umberto Agnelli (right) with [[Gianni Agnelli]], 1965]] Agnelli was chairman of FIAT-controlled [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus Football Club]] between 1956–61 and was honorary chairman from 1970–2004. Agnelli was chairman of Fiat France 1965–80, chief executive officer of Fiat SpA 1970–76 and vice-president 1976–93. He was chairman of Fiat Auto 1980–90 and a member of International Advisory Board 1993–2004. Though he was a senior executive in the family company, Fiat, he was sidelined from taking a leadership role by his brother [[Gianni Agnelli|Gianni]] until the latter's death in 2003. Only then did he take over as chairman of the whole Fiat Group, 2003–2004. The Group controlled several Italian newspapers and publishers in addition to the FIAT car-firms and Juventus. Umberto was in the process of restoring Fiat's fortunes, following a period in which the company's balance sheet, market share and share value had all been in decline, when he suddenly died of [[lung cancer]] after barely 18 months in control. Despite this, ''[[Forbes]]'' magazine estimated he was the world's 68th richest man with an approximate net worth of [[United States dollar|US$]]5.5 billion. He was a member of the Steering Committee of the [[Bilderberg Group]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.bilderbergmeetings.org/former-steering-committee-members.html|title=Former Steering Committee Members|work=bilderbergmeetings.org|publisher=[[Bilderberg Group]]|accessdate=8 February 2014}} ==Family== Agnelli was born in [[Lausanne]], [[Switzerland]], the youngest of seven children. His life was beset by an unusual amount of tragedy and bereavement. His father [[Edoardo Agnelli (industrialist)|Edoardo Agnelli]] perished in an air crash when he was one year old, and his mother [[Virginia Bourbon del Monte|Virginia]] died in a car accident ten years later when he was just 11 years old. In 1959 Agnelli married the heiress ''Donna'' Antonella Bechi Piaggio, from the well-known business-family of [[Piaggio]]. They had three sons but their first, twin boys, died shortly after birth. The third son, [[Giovanni Alberto Agnelli]], grew up to be the head of the maternal family-firm Piaggio, and was being groomed to succeed at Fiat, but died of cancer at the age of 33 in 1997. Umberto and Antonella Agnelli later divorced, and in 1974 Umberto married ''Donna'' Allegra Caracciolo di Castagneto. Allegra is the first cousin of Umberto's sister in law [[Marella Caracciolo di Castagneto]], the wife of his brother Giovanni (Gianni). The ladies come from the old [[Kingdom of Naples|Neapolitan]] [[Nobility|noble]] family that has, among other, the [[Title of nobility|titles of nobility]] of Prince of Castagneto and Duke of Melito. Umberto and Allegra had two children: [[Andrea Agnelli|Andrea]] (born 1975) and Anna (born 1977). Andrea later followed in his father's footsteps by becoming chairman of Juventus, in 2010. == References== {{reflist}} ==Further reading== * Marco Ferrante, ''Casa Agnelli'', Mondadori, 2007, {{ISBN|978-88-04-56673-1}} * Giancarlo Galli, ''Gli Agnelli, il tramonto di una dinastia'', Mondadori, Edizione 2003, {{ISBN|88-04-51768-9}} * [[Alan Friedman]], ''Agnelli and the network of italian power'', Mandarin Paperback (Octopus Publishing Gr.), London, 1988, {{ISBN|0-7493-0093-0}} * Angiolo Silvio Ori, ''Storia di una dinastia – Gli Agnelli e la Fiat'', Editori Riuniti, Roma, 1996 {{ISBN|88-359-4059-1}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Umberto Agnelli}} * [https://www.forbes.com/finance/lists/10/2003/LIR.jhtml?passListId=10&passYear=2003&passListType=Person&uniqueId=5844&datatype=Person/ Forbes Rich List entry] * [https://archive.is/20130422065916/http://news.independent.co.uk/business/analysis_and_features/article62642.ece Obituary] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Agnelli, Umberto}} [[Category:1934 births]] [[Category:2004 deaths]] [[Category:Agnelli family]] [[Category:Deaths from cancer in Italy]] [[Category:Deaths from lymphoma]] [[Category:Fiat people]] [[Category:Italian automotive pioneers]] [[Category:Italian billionaires]] [[Category:Italian businesspeople]] [[Category:Members of the Steering Committee of the Bilderberg Group]] [[Category:People from Lausanne]] [[Category:People from Turin]] [[Category:Juventus F.C. chairmen and investors]] [[Category:Bourbon del Monte family]]

{{Infobox person | name = Viktor Prokopenya | image = Vprokopenya.png | imagesize = | caption = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|mf=yes|1983|7|21}} | birth_place = [[Minsk]], [[Byelorussian Soviet Socialist Republic]] | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = Executive Director at VP Capital (2012—present) | spouse = | children = | website = | footnotes = }}
'''Viktor Prokopenya''' ({{lang-rus|Виктор Михайлович Прокопеня}}, {{lang-be|Віктар Пракапеня}}, '''Viktar Prakapenya''', born July 21, 1983) is a technology entrepreneur and venture investor born in Belarus, now residing in [[London]], [[United Kingdom|UK]]. He created [[Viaden Media]], a software development company, and after its sale he founded the investment company VP Capital. Prokopenya is one of the initiators and developers of the Belarusian [[Decree on Development of Digital Economy]].<ref name=ed.meduza>{{cite web |url = https://meduza.io/feature/2017/12/23/aytishnyy-gonkong-dlya-slavyanskogo-mira |title = "Айтишный Гонконг для славянского мира". Что за "революционный" закон в IT-сфере приняла Белоруссия |author = Olga Korelina |date = 2017-12-23 |publisher = Meduza |language = Russian |trans-title = “IT Hong Kong for the Slavic world”. What kind of "revolutionary" law in IT adopted Belarus }}</ref>
== Education ==
Viktor Prokopenya was born in [[Minsk]], in the former [[Byelorussian Soviet Socialist Republic]], in 1983. He was born into a family of scientists: his father received a doctorate in Physical and Mathematical Sciences, worked at the [[Belarusian State University]] and later at the [[Belarusian National Technical University]], while his mother was a mathematician. He studied in schools No. 2 and No. 130, where he graduated with distinction. He received a: [[bachelor]]'s degree in law from the [[Belarusian State University]], bachelor's degree in information technology from the [[European Humanities University]] and a degree in software development from the [[Belarusian State University of Informatics and Radioelectronics]]. He has also graduated from the Minsk IPM Business School (gaining a master's degree in Business Administration), before continuing his higher education abroad at [[Full Sail University]] (gaining a master's degree in Internet Marketing), executive MBA courses at [[Stanford Graduate School of Business]] (Strategic Marketing) and [[Northeastern University]] in [[Boston]] (gaining a master's degree in finance). In 2017 he completed his [[Doctor of Business Administration|doctorate in business administration]] at the [[SBS Swiss Business School]].<ref name=ed.tut>{{cite web |url = https://42.tut.by/378058 |title = IT.TUT.BY готовит рейтинг белорусских ИТ-стартапов |author = Nikolay Shchetko |date = 2013-12-20 |publisher = TUT.BY |language = Russian |trans-title = IT.TUT.BY prepares a rating of Belarusian IT startups }}</ref><ref name=10facts.vestiukr>{{cite web |url = http://business.vesti-ukr.com/247248-10-faktov-o-belorusskom-millionere-vedushchem-perehovory-o-pokupke-sberbanka-ukrainy |title = 10 фактов о белорусском миллионере, ведущем переговоры о покупке Сбербанка Украины |date = 2017-07-14 |publisher = Vesti-ukr.com |language = Russian |trans-title = 10 facts about a Belorusian millionaire, who is negotiating the purchase of Ukraine’s Sberbank }}</ref><ref name=telegraf-oct2017>{{cite web |url = https://telegraf.by/2017/10/46/366079-kak-stanovyatsya-milliarderami-v-belarusi-i-kto-sleduyuschii |title = Как становятся миллиардерами в Беларуси. И кто следующий |date = 2017-10-03 |language = Russian |trans-title = How to become billionaires in Belarus. And who's next }}</ref><ref name=childhood>{{cite web |url = http://minskherald.com/2017/11/trends-by-viktor-prokopenya/ |title = Trends by Viktor Prokopenya |publisher = The Minsk Herald |date = 2017-11-10 }}</ref>
== Entrepreneurship == === Viaden Media ===
At the age of 16 Prokopenya took on the responsibility of caring for his family, when his father,<ref>{{cite web |url = https://neg.by/novosti/otkrytj/kak-nachinal-samyj-krupnyj-nalogoplatelschik-belarusi |title = Как начинал самый крупный налогоплательщик Беларуси: сборка компьютеров в 13 лет, разработка сайтов в 16 |author = |date = 2018-11-26 |publisher = neg.by |language = Russian |trans-title = How the largest taxpayer of Belarus started: computer assembly at 13, website development at 16 }}</ref> who had started a business in the 1990s, died in a car accident. In the 2000s, Prokopenya focused on IT consulting and running [[Viaden Media]], the IT company that he founded. In 2006, he reoriented Viaden to develop their own IT products.<ref name=lifetime.ubr /><ref name=childhood />
In 2009 the company launched a mobile applications department, headed by [[Yuri Gurski]]. The company developed numerous top-rated applications including ''All-in Fitness'', which sustained top ranking positions on the [[AppStore]] Healthcare & Fitness category in 40 countries for several months. Viaden achieved in excess of 200 million mobile application installations. By 2011 the company was the largest mobile phone software developer in the post-Soviet region. Prokopenya ran the company until 2011 when he sold it, for €95 million, to [[Teddy Sagi]], an Israeli entrepreneur and founder of [[Playtech]] software company. Later Viaden Media was divided into two companies: Sport.com (the largest developer of fitness applications, and owner of sites sport.com and yoga.com) and the Skywind Group (which specialises in mobile and social games).<ref name=gursky.ej>{{cite web |url = https://ej.by/rating/business2017/yuriy-gurskiy.html |title = Юрий Гурский |date = 2017 |publisher = Ежедневник |language = Russian }}</ref><ref name=95mln>{{cite web |url = http://www.rbc.ru/technology_and_media/11/03/2016/56e158739a79473e42093a9b |title = Минский экспресс: зачем Facebook купил совсем молодой сервис MSQRD |author = Alena Sukharevskaya, Ivan Osipov |date = 2016-03-11 |publisher = RBC |language = Russian |trans-title = Minsk Express: why did Facebook buy a very young MSQRD service }}</ref><ref name=lifetime.ukr />
=== VP Capital ===
In 2012, Prokopenya founded his investment company, VP Capital, which has a focus on the technology sector. Later this year he started the fintech company exp(capital), which develops solutions for banks and brokers in order to construct algorithms for high frequency market making. The company is located in the [[Belarus High Technologies Park]], and was ranked the best employer of the year in 2014. The mobile applications department of exp(capital) was acquired by the British company [[IG Group|IG Holdings]] for an undisclosed sum.<ref name=exp.tut>{{cite web |url = https://42.tut.by/388164 |title = Как белорусский стартап exp(capital) зарабатывает на том, что сложно даже скопировать |author = Катерина Сипакова |date = 2014-02-28 |publisher = TUT.by |language = Russian |trans-title = Belarussian startup exp (capital) earn on the fact that it is difficult even copy }}</ref><ref name=lifetime.ubr />
Prokopenya also established VP Capital's Real Estate company in 2012 and acquired a number of key commercial real estate assets in the center of [[Minsk]]—by 2017, the company became the largest private owner of real estate of its kind in Minsk.<ref name=2017bio.pro /><ref name=lifetime.ubr>{{cite web |url = http://ubr.ua/ukraine-and-world/technology/ajtishnyj-bankir-kak-it-biznes-dovel-viktora-prokopenju-do-pokupki-bankov-3848272 |title = Айтишный банкир. Как IT-бизнес довел Виктора Прокопеню до покупки банков |date = 2017-07-14 |publisher = UBR.ua |language = Russian |trans-title = IT-banker. How IT-business led Prokopenya to buy banks }}</ref><ref name=lifetime.ukr>{{cite web |url = https://www.ukrinform.ru/rubric-economy/2265941-kto-vy-pretendent-na-pokupku-sberbanka.html |title = Кто вы, претендент на покупку Сбербанка? |date = 2017-07-14 |publisher = Укринформ |language = Russian |trans-title = Who are you, a candidate for buying Sberbank? }}</ref>
In December 2016, together with the Larnabel Ventures Fund, owned by [[Mikhail Gutseriyev|Gutseriev]] family, Prokopenya announced his intention to invest over $100 million in artificial intelligence startup businesses.<ref name=2017bio.pro /><ref name=100.secret>{{cite web |url = http://secretmag.ru/news/2016/12/15/guceriev-i-prokopenya-vlozhat-usd100-mln-v-iskusstvennyj-intellekt/ |title = Гуцериев и Прокопеня вложат $100 млн в искусственный интеллект |date = 2016-12-15 |publisher = The firm’s secret |language = Russian |trans-title = Gutseriev and Prokopenya will invest $ 100 million in artificial intelligence }}</ref> In February 2017 the partners announced five investment agreements, in which they have invested equally: * VP Capital and Larnabel Ventures together with Vast Ventures and GVA Capital invested $16.65 million in the Russian-American company '''Astro Digital''', which develops satellites and a real-time monitoring system of the Earth's surface;<ref name=astro.sk>{{cite web |url = https://sk.ru/news/b/articles/archive/2017/03/13/astro-digital-razvernet-sputnikovuyu-gruppirovku-do-konca-goda.aspx |title = Astro Digital развернет спутниковую группировку до конца года |author = Mikhail Baklanov |date = 2017-03-13 |publisher = Skolkovo |language = Russian |trans-title = Astro Digital will launch the satellite group by the end of the year }}</ref><ref name=astro.rbc>{{cite web |url = http://www.rbc.ru/business/01/02/2017/5891f9249a7947378df8ae0b |title = Фонд Гуцериевых вложится в российско-американский космический проект |author = Valeriya Komarova |date = 2017-02-01 |publisher = RBC |language = Russian |trans-title = The Gutseriev Foundation will invest in a Russian-American space project }}</ref><ref name=2017bio.pro>{{cite web |url = https://probusiness.io/strategy/3146-chem-zanimaetsya-it-predprinimatel-viktor-prokopenya-k-kotoromu-segodnya-prikhodil-prezident.html |title = Чем занимается ИТ-предприниматель Виктор Прокопеня, к которому приходил президент |date = 2017-03-17 |publisher = Про бизнес. |language = Russian |trans-title = What is the IT entrepreneur Viktor Prokopenya doing, to whom the president came? }}</ref> On 14 July 2017, the company successfully launched its first two satellites into orbit.<ref name=astro.techcrunch>{{cite web |url = https://techcrunch.com/2017/07/14/astro-digital-launched-its-first-imaging-satellites/ |title = Astro Digital launched its first imaging satellites |author = Jonathan Shieber, Ingrid Lunden |date = 2017-07-14 |publisher = [[Techcrunch]] }}</ref> * '''Banuba''', a company which develops applications based on [[augmented reality]] technologies, with the development center in Minsk, was allocated $5 million. An additional investment amounting to $7 million was announced in November 2018.<ref>{{cite web |url = https://techcrunch.com/2018/11/26/banuba-raises-7m-to-supercharge-any-app-or-device-with-the-ability-to-really-see-you/?guccounter=2 |title = Banuba raises $7M to supercharge any app or device with the ability to really see you |author = |date = 2018-11-26 |publisher = techcrunch.com }}</ref> The company specialises in neural networks and machine learning algorithms that are capable of revealing and identifying objects, and facial expressions in real time.<ref name=banuba.vc>{{cite web |url = https://vc.ru/n/banuba-larnabel-invest |title = VP Capital и фонд владельца "Эльдорадо" инвестировали $5 млн в AR-стартап Banuba с центром разработки в Минске |author = Albert Habibrahimov |date = 2017-02-22 |publisher = Vc.ru |language = Russian |trans-title = VP Capital and “Eldorado” owner’s fund invested $5 mln in AR-startup Banuba with the development center in Minsk }}</ref><ref name=2017bio.pro /><ref name=camerafirst.dev>{{cite web |url = https://dev.by/lenta/main/banuba-i-inventain-zapuskayut-sovmestnuyu-produktovuyu-kompaniyu |title = "Хотим создать большую AR-экосистему". Banuba и Inventain запускают продуктовую компанию |date = 2017-10-25 |publisher = Dev.by |language = Russian |trans-title = "We want to create a large AR-ecosystem". Banuba and Inventain launch a product company }}</ref> * The partners took a stake in '''Dronefence''' company that develops defences against unmanned aerial vehicles. The investment size was undisclosed.<ref name=antidron.pro>{{cite web |url = https://probusiness.by/tech/3425-novyy-trend-vse-chto-anti-viktor-prokopenya-raskryl-podrobnosti-svoikh-investiciy-v-antidrony.html |title = "Новый тренд — все, что «анти". Виктор Прокопеня раскрыл подробности своих инвестиций в антидроны |date = 2017-06-05 |publisher = Про бизнес. |language = Russian |trans-title = “Everything that is “anti” is a new trend”. Viktor Prokopenya revealed some details about his investments in antidrones }}</ref> * '''Capital.com''', a fintech startup developing mobile applications for retail investors was allocated $25 million. The Artificial Intelligence enhanced application allows users to trade wide range of financial instruments from their smartphones and provides them with access to educational materials.<ref name=capitalcom.rbc>{{cite web |url = http://www.rbc.ru/finances/18/07/2017/596e28e79a794789c7d2322a |title = Гуцериев инвестировал в трейдинговый стартап с искусственным интеллектом |date = 2017-07-18 |authors = Ivan Tkachev, Marina Bozhko, Oleg Makarov |publisher = RBC |language = Russian |trans-title = Gutseriev invested in a trading startup with artificial intelligence. }}</ref> * VP Capital and Larnabel Ventures invested $2 million in '''FaceMetrics''', a startup that specialises in artificial intelligence apps for children's education.<ref name=facemetrics.venturebeat>{{cite web |url = https://venturebeat.com/2018/06/13/facemetrics-lands-2-million-to-gamify-kids-screen-time-and-track-immersion-with-ai |title = FaceMetrics lands $2 million to gamify kids’ screen time and track immersion with AI |date = 2018-06-13 |authors = Stewart Rogers |publisher = venturebeat.com}}</ref><ref name=facemetrics.tut.by>{{cite web |url = https://news.tut.by/economics/596905.html |date = 2018-06-14 |authors = venturebeat |publisher = venturebeat}}</ref>
==Attempt to acquire bank==
In the summer of 2017 it was announced that VP Capital planned to buy Paritetbank, and that the $50 million deal had been approved by the authorities.<ref name=paritetbank.rbc>{{cite web |url = http://www.rbc.ru/rbcfreenews/597220c59a7947229dea13f1 |title = Власти Белоруссии разрешили VP Capital купить Паритетбанк |date = 2017-07-21 |publisher = RBC |language = Russian |trans-title = Belorusian authorities allowed VP Capital to buy “Paritetbank”. }}</ref> Alexander Timoshenko, the press secretary of the National Bank of Belarus, noted that the Belarusian regulator welcomes the Belarusian investor coming in to the banking sector, taking into account his good reputation and experience in the information technologies sector. <ref name=paritetbank.tut>{{cite web |url = https://news.tut.by/economics/551849.html |title = Президент дал добро на покупку Виктором Прокопеней Паритетбанка за 50 млн долларов |date = 2017-07-21 |publisher = Tut.by |language = Russian |trans-title = The President gave the green light to purchase Victor Prokopenya Paritetbank for $ 50 million }}</ref> In an interview to [[Tut.By]], Viktor Prokopenya claimed that bank acquisition is direct and important development of his experience in IT and fintech.<ref>{{cite web |url = https://news.tut.by/economics/549475.html |title = Виктор Прокопеня близок к покупке сразу двух банков — Паритетбанка и Сбербанка Украины |publisher = Tut.by |date = 2017-06-30 |language = Russian |trans-title = Viktor Prokopenya is close to acquisition of two banks at once - Paritetbank and Ukraine's Sberbank}}</ref> Later, presidential edict approving the sale of Paritetbank was abolished.<ref>{{cite web |url = https://officelife.media/news/victor-procaine-canceled-the-purchase-of-paritetbank/part1/ |title = Виктору Прокопене отменили покупку Паритетбанка |publisher = Officelife.media |date = 2017-08-21 |language = Russian |trans-title = Bank acquisition was abolished to Viktor Prokopenya}}</ref> However, his company claimed that their focus is fintech of capital.com which develops mobile applications in sphere of finances.<ref>{{cite web |url = https://naviny.by/article/20170803/1501773402-prokopenya-peredumal-pokupat-ukrainskiy-sberbank |title = Прокопеня передумал покупать украинский "Сбербанк" |publisher = naviny.by |date = 2017-08-03 |language = Russian |trans-title = Prokopenya decided not to buy the Ukrainian "Sberbank"}}</ref> VP Capital also attempted to acquire [[Sberbank of Russia|Sberbank]]'s banking business in Ukraine, but later withdrew the deal in order to focus on other projects.<ref name=otkaz>{{cite web |url = http://www.rbc.ru/finances/03/08/2017/598332749a7947245c5aa1ad |title = Виктор Прокопеня отказался от покупки "дочки" Сбербанка на Украине |author = Eugeny Kaljukov, Marina Bozhko |date = 2017-08-03 |publisher = RBC |language = Russian |trans-title = Belorusian businessman Prokopenya refused to buy the Ukrainian subsidiary of Sberbank }}</ref>
== Legal Initiatives ==
In March 2017 Viktor Prokopenya proposed development of legislation for the use of [[Self-driving car|autonomous cars]],<ref name=auto.belta>{{cite web |url = http://www.belta.by/president/view/lukashenko-podderzhal-ideju-sozdanija-uslovij-dlja-ispolzovanija-v-belarusi-bespilotnyh-avtomobilej-237207-2017/ |title = Лукашенко поддержал идею создания условий для использования в Беларуси беспилотных автомобилей |date = 2017-03-13 |publisher = The Belarusian Telegraph Agency |language = Russian |trans-title = Lukashenko supported the idea of creating conditions for the use of autonomous cars in Belarus }}</ref> [[cryptocurrency]]<ref name=crypto.tut>{{cite web |url = https://news.tut.by/economics/551605.html |title = Как будет выглядеть ИТ-страна: с беспилотниками, криптовалютами и без бюрократии |date = 2017-07-17 |publisher = TUT.BY |language = Russian |trans-title = How the IT-country will look like: with drones, cryptocurrencies and without bureaucracy }}</ref> and the development of initiatives designed to stimulate the IT industry in Belarus.<ref name=it.belta>{{cite web |url = http://www.belta.by/society/view/janchevskij-sozdat-it-stranu-belarus-otkryvaet-novyj-etap-v-razvitii-sfery-vysokih-tehnologij-237239-2017/ |title = Янчевский: "Создать IT-страну" - Беларусь открывает новый этап в развитии сферы высоких технологий |date = 2017-03-13 |publisher = The Belarusian Telegraph Agency |language = Russian |trans-title = Yanchevsky: "To create an IT-country" - Belarus opens a new stage in the development of the sphere of high technologies. }}</ref> On 22 December 2017, President [[Alexander Lukashenko]] signed into law the [[Decree on Development of Digital Economy|Decree on the Development of a Digital Economy]].<ref>{{cite web |url= https://news.tut.by/economics/558485.html |title= Декрет о развитии цифровой экономики: что написано в документе, обещающем великую ИТ-революцию |date=2017-12-22 |publisher=Tut.by |language = Russian |trans-title = Decree on the development of the digital economy: what is written in the document promising a great IT revolution }}</ref>
==Top taxpayer of Belarus==
Viktor Prokopenya became the top [[taxpayer]] of [[Belarus]] for the years 2016 and 2017, consecutively.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://dev.by/lenta/main/viktar-prakapenya-pays-his-taxes |title= Виктор Прокопеня стал крупнейшим налогоплательщиком Минска, заплатив 7 млн рублей |date=2018-05-23 |publisher=Dev.by |language = Russian |trans-title = Viktor Prokopenya has become the largest taxpayer of Minsk, having paid 7 billion rubles }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.ctv.by/takie-finansovye-instrumenty-nuzhno-pokupat-na-dengi-kotorye-ne-zhalko-poteryat-prokopenya-o |title = "Такие финансовые инструменты нужно покупать на деньги, которые не жалко потерять": Прокопеня о биткоинах, блокчейне и совещании у Президента |author = |date = 2017-12-19 |publisher = ctv.by |language = Russian |trans-title =“Such financial instruments need to be bought with money that is not a pity to lose”: Prokopen about bitcoins, blockchain and meeting with the President }}</ref>
==Critics, controversies and accusations==
Viktor Prokopenya initiated legislation changes that were aimed to: introduce special tax remunerations until 2049 for IT sector, remove bureaucracy and regulate distributed ledger technologies. The regulation was called “Decree 8” was approved and went into force on 28 March 2018. Decree 8 initiative was criticized by Belarussian economist Serge Chaly, who pinpointed a number of bubbles in distributed ledger technology space.<ref>{{cite web |url = https://news.tut.by/economics/570671.html |title = Беларусь начала продвижение IT страны на внешний мир |author = |date = 2017-11-28 |publisher = Tut.by |language = Russian |trans-title =Belarus began to promote the country's IT to the outside world }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.sovrep.gov.by/ru/news-ru/view/zasedanie-parlamentskoj-assamblei-tsentralno-evropejskoj-initsiativy-v-minske-12124-2017/ |title = Заседание Парламентской ассамблеи Центрально-Европейской Инициативы в Минске |author = |date = 2017-11-28 |publisher = sovrep.gov.by |language = Russian |trans-title = Session of the Parliamentary Assembly of the Central European Initiative in Minsk }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url = https://dev.by/news/prokopenya-belarus-gotova-obespechit-polnuyu-svobodu-it-industrii |title = Прокопеня: Беларусь готова обеспечить полную свободу ИТ-индустрии |author = |date = 2017-11-28 |publisher = Dev.by |language = Russian |trans-title = Prokopenya: Belarus is ready to ensure complete freedom of the IT industry }}</ref>
He also argued, that it doesn't help the broader economy when IT industry receives special tax regime. As a result of decree 8 regulations IT sector grew 40% in 2018 contributing to 25% of Belarussian GDP growth in 2018. However, Denis Filazarovich on Kastrychnicki economichny forum said that he doesn't see how this growth can continue at this rate.<ref>{{cite web |url = https://belaruspartisan.by/economic/444115/ |title = Прокопеня: IT – источник независимости. Что ответил скептик |author = |date = 2018-11-06 |publisher = Belaruspartisan.by |language = Russian |trans-title = Prokopenya: IT - the source of independence. What the skeptic answered }}</ref> Prokopenya argued, that providing improved fiscal incentives will make IT grow, not at the expense of Belarussian economy, but due to increasing Belarussian IT sector share in international markets. Arguing that Belarus will get more export proceeds and that the whole economy will be grow due to a multiplier effect.<ref>{{cite web |url = https://tech.onliner.by/2018/11/05/belarus-36 |title = "За этот год IT вырастет на $500 миллионов". Бизнесмены об IT-стране |author = |date = 2018-11-05 |publisher = Onliner.by |language = Russian |trans-title = "This year IT will grow by $ 500 million." Businessmen about IT-country }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url = https://naviny.by/new/20181105/1541436006-prokopenya-chetvert-ekonomicheskogo-rosta-belarusi-budet-obespechena-za |title = Прокопеня: четверть экономического роста Беларуси будет обеспечена за счет ИТ |author = |date = 2018-11-05 |publisher = Naviny.by |language = Russian |trans-title = Prokopenya: a quarter of Belarus’s economic growth will be provided by IT }}</ref> Viktor Martinovich argued that regulating IT under different rules compared to the rest of economy is not a sustainable practice, and that it is necessary to make structural changes in both the economy and government to develop Belarus as a whole.<ref>{{cite web |url = https://www.zeit.de/kultur/2018-01/belarus-viktor-martinovich-it-boom-cryptocurrency |title = Сеул в центре Пхеньяна |author = Victor Martinovich |date = 2018-02-02 |publisher = Zeit.de |language = Russian |trans-title = Seoul in the center of Pyongyang }}</ref>
Viktor Prokopenya invited S.Chaly to publicly discuss the new legislation concerning the regulation of the IT industry and cryptocurrencies. Sergei Chaly initially agreed but later changed his mind”.<ref>{{cite web |url = https://dev.by/news/prokopenya-vs-chaly |title = Прокопеня вызвал Чалого на "батл" по поводу Декрета о ПВТ 2.0 (обновлено) |author = |date = 2017-12-26 |publisher = Dev.by |language = Russian |trans-title = Prokopenya summoned Chaly in a "battle" on the Decree on the HTP 2.0 (updated) }}</ref>
In June 2018, Viktor Prokopenya commented the opening of the restaurant nearby Kurapaty. According to him, the restaurant should be closed, not by the state, but by the owner, and all socially responsible Belarusians should boycott all restaurants owned by the owner.<ref>{{cite web |url = https://dev.by/lenta/main/IT-i-poedem-poedim |title = "Ресторан в Куропатах должен быть закрыт — владельцами". Прокопеня и другие о том, как быть с "Поедем поедим" |publisher = Dev.by |date = 2018-06-18 |language = Russian |trans-title = Restaurant in Kurapaty should be closed - by owners. Prokopenya and others on how to handle "Let's ride. Let's eat"}}</ref>
On November 5, 2018, at the International Economic Forum (IEF) Prokopenya supported the idea of a moratorium relating to the death penalty in Belarus.<ref name="dw.com">{{cite web |url = https://www.dw.com/ru/it-сфера-станет-мотором-белорусской-экономики/a-46171605 |title = IT-сфера станет мотором белорусской экономики? |author = |date = 2018-11-06 |publisher = Deutsche Welle |language = Russian |trans-title = Will IT become the engine of the Belarusian economy? }}</ref> He argued that this is good for society and that this would reduce the cost of interest payouts on the state debt of Belarus. Prokopenya said that Belarus pays around 5% a year interest on debt obligations and that this is high for Belarus, which has debt less than 30% of its GDP. Critics argued that these calculations are inaccurate and that there is no connection between abolishing the death penalty in Belarus and reducing the country's debt burden. Some critics agreed that a moratorium on the death penalty will improve relations between Belarus and the European Union, and that this could affect the rating of the Belarusian Eurobonds and possibly rendering new debt cheaper.<ref>{{cite web |url = https://gazetaby.com/cont/art.php?sn_nid=144050 |title = Прокопеня: отмена смертной казни выгодна Беларуси |author = |date = 2018-11-05 |publisher = Gazetaby.com |language = Russian |trans-title =Prokopenya: abolition of capital punishment is beneficial to Belarus }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url = https://nn.by/?c=ar&i=221274&lang=ru |title = Виктор Прокопеня объяснил, что было бы с Беларусью в случае захвата ее Россией |author = |date = 2018-11-26 |publisher = NN.by |language = Russian |trans-title =Victor Prokopenya explained what would happen to Belarus if Russia seized it }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url = https://belaruspartisan.by/economic/446360/ |title = Виктор Прокопеня об объединении Беларуси с РФ: что будет с экономикой в этом случае |author = |date = 2018-11-27 |publisher = Belaruspartisan.by |language = Russian |trans-title =Viktor Prokopenya about the unification of Belarus with the Russian Federation: what will happen to the economy in this case }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.iarex.ru/news/62051.html |title =БЕЛОРУССКИЙ БИЗНЕСМЕН: "КРЫМ СТАЛ ЧЕРНОБЫЛЬСКОЙ ЗОНОЙ" |author = |date = 2018-11-27 |publisher = Iarex.ru |language = Russian |trans-title =BELARUSIAN BUSINESSMAN: “THE CRIMEA BECAME THE CHERNOBYL ZONE” }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url = https://neg.by/novosti/otkrytj/viktor-prokopenya-ob-obedinenii-belarusi-s-rf |title = Виктор Прокопеня об объединении Беларуси с РФ: что будет с экономикой в этом случае |author = |date = 2018-11-26 |publisher = Neg.by |language = Russian |trans-title = Viktor Prokopenya about the unification of Belarus with the Russian Federation: what will happen to the economy in this case }}</ref>
In the spring of 2015, Viktor Prokopenya was detained by Belarusian state authorities and was suspected in unregistered business activity, earning profits to the sum of $650,000.<ref>{{cite web |url = https://news.tut.by/economics/442587.html |title = СК: Задержанный ИТ-бизнесмен обвиняется в получении 650 тысяч долларов от незаконной деятельности |date = 2015-04-03 |publisher = TUT.by |language = Russian |trans-title = Investigative Committee: Detained IT-businessman accused of receiving 650 thousand dollars from illegal activities |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20171222215910/https://news.tut.by/economics/442587.html |archivedate = 2017-12-22 }}</ref><ref name="Deutsche Welle">{{cite web | url = http://www.dw.com/ru/%D0%B0%D1%80%D0%B5%D1%81%D1%82-%D0%B1%D0%B8%D0%B7%D0%BD%D0%B5%D1%81%D0%BC%D0%B5%D0%BD%D0%B0-%D0%B2%D0%B8%D0%BA%D1%82%D0%BE%D1%80%D0%B0-%D0%BF%D1%80%D0%BE%D0%BA%D0%BE%D0%BF%D0%B5%D0%BD%D0%B8-%D0%B3%D1%80%D0%BE%D0%B7%D0%B8%D1%82-%D0%BC%D0%B8%D0%BD%D1%81%D0%BA%D1%83-%D1%83%D1%89%D0%B5%D1%80%D0%B1%D0%BE%D0%BC-%D0%BD%D0%B0-%D0%BC%D0%B8%D0%BB%D0%BB%D0%B8%D0%BE%D0%BD%D1%8B-%D0%B4%D0%BE%D0%BB%D0%BB%D0%B0%D1%80%D0%BE%D0%B2/a-18374236 | title = Арест бизнесмена Виктора Прокопени грозит Минску ущербом на миллионы долларов | publisher = Deutsche Welle | date = 2015-04-11 |language = Russian |trans-title = The arrest of businessman Viktor Prokopenya threatens Minsk with millions of dollars of damage }}</ref> [[Deutsche Welle]], and [[Belarus]]ian IT experts alleged that the detainment of Viktor Prokopenya could potentially cause hundreds of million of dollars in damages to Belarus.<ref name="Deutsche Welle»"/> The IT business community came to the defense of Prokopenya<ref name="dw.com"/> Viktor Prokopenya was released on bail.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://news.vice.com/article/are-you-a-budding-tech-innovator-head-to-repressive-belarus|title=Are You a Budding Tech Innovator? Head to Repressive Belarus|last=Dyer|first=John|date=6 April 2016|publisher=[[Vice News]]|accessdate=24 December 2017}}</ref><ref name="freed">{{cite web |url = https://news.tut.by/economics/543875.html |title = Финал громкого ИТ-дела: инкриминируемый ущерб возмещен, бизнесмен отпущен из СИЗО |date = 2015-12-23 |publisher = TUT.by |language = Russian |trans-title = The final of a loud IT case: the incriminated damages are reimbursed, the businessman is released from jail |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20171222215940/https://news.tut.by/economics/543875.html |archivedate = 2017-12-22 }}</ref> In February 2016, all allegations against him were dropped after authorities failed to uncover any violations.<ref name="100mln">{{cite web | url = https://news.tut.by/economics/523767.html | title = Искусственный интеллект. Михаил Гуцериев и Виктор Прокопеня стали партнерами | date = 2016-12-15 | publisher = TUT.by | language = Russian | trans-title = Artificial Intelligence. Mikhail Gutseriev and Viktor Prokopenya became partners }}</ref> The story of the investigation gained widespread media coverage in Belarus. At the end of 2017, Prokopenya's legal advisors approached various Belarusian media channels, including [[BelaPAN]], [[Belarusian Telegraph Agency|BelTA]], [[European Radio for Belarus]], [[Narodnaja Volya (newspaper)|Narodnaja Volya]], [[Nasha Niva]], [[Onliner.by]], [[Tut.By]], requesting the removal or correction of old news stories which contained incorrect information. Many outlets corrected the publications or deleted them, and this provoked discussions concerning [[Journalism ethics and standards|journalism ethics]].<ref name="Ольга Жерносек">{{cite web|author= Ольга Жерносек |title=Цензура Прокопени. Кто и почему скрывает от нас правду? [Prokopenya's Censorship: who is hiding the truth from us, and why?]|url=https://belsat.eu/ru/in-focus/tsenzura-prokopeni-kto-i-pochemu-skryvaet-ot-nas-pravdu/|publisher=Belsat|date=2017-12-27|accessdate=2017-12-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=#Прокопенягейт: Социальные сети гудят, независимые медиа говорят "ничего страшного не случилось"|url=http://mediakritika.by/article/4830/prokopenyageyt-socialnye-seti-gudyat-nezavisimye-media-govoryat-nichego-strashnogo-ne|website=Mediakritika.by | date = 2017-12-27 | language = Russian | trans-title = # Prokopenyagate: Social networks are buzzing, independent media say "nothing terrible has happened" }}</ref><ref name="udf">{{cite web| url = http://udf.by/news/main_news/170652-istoriya-s-udaleniem-kontenta-novye-podrobnosti.html| title = История с удалением контента: новые подробности| date = 2018-03-13| publisher = UDF.by | language = Russian | trans-title = History with content removal: new details}}</ref>
== Honours & awards == The Belarusian media has repeatedly included Prokopenya in the rankings of notable Belarusian entrepreneurs. In the list of the 200 most successful and influential businessmen of Belarus, published by the Internet newspaper Ezednevnik, Prokopenya was awarded the 184th place in 2011,<ref name=2011.ej>{{cite web |url = https://ej.by/rating/business2011/prokopenya.html |title = Виктор Прокопеня — ТОП 200 успешных и влиятельных бизнесменов Беларуси — 2011 |publisher = Ежедневник |language = Russian |trans-title = Viktor Prokopenya - Top 200 successful and influential businessmen of Belarus — 2011 }}</ref> the 47th in 2013,<ref name=2013.ej>{{cite web |url = https://ej.by/rating/business2013/prokopenia.html |title = Виктор Прокопеня — ТОП 200 успешных и влиятельных бизнесменов Беларуси — 2013 |publisher = Ежедневник |language = Russian |trans-title = Viktor Prokopenya - Top 200 successful and influential businessmen of Belarus — 2013 }}</ref> the 45th in 2016,<ref name=2016.ej>{{cite web |url = https://ej.by/rating/business2016/prokopenia.html |title = Виктор Прокопеня — ТОП 200 успешных и влиятельных бизнесменов Беларуси — 2016 |publisher = Ежедневник |language = Russian |trans-title = Viktor Prokopenya - Top 200 successful and influential businessmen of Belarus — 2016 }}</ref> the 23rd in 2017,<ref name=2017.ej>{{cite web |url = https://ej.by/rating/business2017/prokopenia.html |title = Виктор Прокопеня — ТОП 200 успешных и влиятельных бизнесменов Беларуси — 2017 |publisher = Ежедневник |language = Russian |trans-title = Viktor Prokopenya - Top 200 successful and influential businessmen of Belarus — 2017 }}</ref> and the 12th in 2018.<ref name=2018.ej>{{cite web |url = https://ej.by/rating/business2018/prokopenia.html |title = Виктор Прокопеня — ТОП 200 успешных и влиятельных бизнесменов Беларуси — 2018 |publisher = Ежедневник |language = Russian |trans-title = Viktor Prokopenya - Top 200 successful and influential businessmen of Belarus — 2018 }}</ref> In the list of 25 most influential businessmen of Belarus from 1992 till 2017, also published by Ezhednevnik, he received 13th place.<ref name="ej25">{{cite web| url = https://ej.by/news/companies/2018/02/12/alexandr-moshenskiy-vozglavil-top-25-vydayuschihsya-biznesmenov.html| title = Александр Мошенский возглавил топ-25 выдающихся бизнесменов современной Беларуси | trans-title = Alexander Moshensky topped the top 25 outstanding businessmen of modern Belarus | language = Russian | author = Vadim Sechovich | date = 2018-02-12| publisher = Ежедневник |accessdate=2018-04-11}}</ref> Viktor Prokopenya has been named Belarus's "Entrepreneur of the Year" three times.<ref name="interfax">{{cite web| url = https://www.interfax.by/news/belarus/1226658 | title = IT-бизнесмен Прокопеня – вновь самый крупный плательщик подоходного налога в Беларуси| date = 2017-06-30| publisher = Interfax.by | language = Russian | trans-title = IT-businessman Prokopenya is again the largest payer of income tax in Belarus }}</ref>
Prokopenya has 4 million followers on Instagram making him the most followed instagrammer in Belarus,<ref>{{cite web |url = https://42.tut.by/614933 |title = Десять самых популярных Instagram-аккаунтов белорусов |author = |date = 2018-11-11 |publisher = Tut.by |language = Russian |trans-title = Ten most popular Instagram accounts of Belarusians }}</ref> and the third most followed enterpeneur influencer with in the UK.<ref>{{cite web |url = https://www.heepsy.com/ranking/top-9-technology-influencers |title = Top 9 technology influencers in 2018 |author = |date = |publisher = Heepsy.com }}</ref>
== Personal life == Prokopenya is married and has two sons.<ref>{{cite web |url = https://news.tut.by/economics/616637.html |title = "Надо провести черту". Прокопеня — об амнистии бизнеса, объединении с Россией и жене |author = |date = 2018-11-23 |publisher = Tut.by |trans-title = "We must draw a line." Prokopenya - on business amnesty, association with Russia and his wife |language = Russian }}</ref> He lives and works in [[London]]. His hobbies include photography, [[hockey]], [[snowboarding]], [[Underwater diving|diving]], [[cycling]] and reading.<ref name=2013.ej /><ref name=lifetime.ukr /><ref name=10facts.vestiukr />

[[File:Vilhelm Pacht 1888.jpg|thumb|185px|Vilhelm Pacht (1888)]] [[File:Pacht-wilhelm-1843-1912-denmar-en-forstyrret-middagsluur.jpg|thumb|325px|The Interrupted Nap]] '''Lauritz Vilhelm Pacht''' (23 November 1843, [[Copenhagen]] – 20 May 1912, [[Holte]]) was a Danish [[Genre art|genre]] painter, industrialist and philanthropist.
==Biography== His father was a cap maker. After his confirmation, he began to learn printing, but was later apprenticed to a marble chipper.<ref name="D">[http://denstoredanske.dk/Dansk_Biografisk_Leksikon/Kunst_og_kultur/Billedkunst/Maler/Vilhelm_Pacht Brief biography] @ Den Store Danske.</ref> While taking classes at the [[Copenhagen Technical College]], his drawings attracted the attention of [[G.F. Hetsch]], who advised him to take up [[porcelain painting]]. After completing his courses, he was given a position at the [[Royal Porcelain Factory]], which he held from 1862 to 1867.<ref name="D" />
Beginning in 1861, he also attended classes at the [[Royal Danish Academy of Fine Arts]]; passing his final exam in 1866. He began to have showings at the [[Charlottenborg Spring Exhibition]] and, in 1869, was awarded the {{ill|Neuhausenske Prize|da|De Neuhausenske Præmier}}.<ref name="D" />
For several years, he worked to perfect a method to improve the reproduction of drawings by printing press. In 1872, he received a patent for his processes and set up a workshop for what he called the "Heliotype" (a process similar to [[hectography]]). Later, he also produced [[phototype]]s.<ref name="K" /> In 1880, he joined with the photographer, {{ill|Hilmar Crone|da}}, to create "Pacht & Crones Illustrationsetablissement". Crone left the company in 1885 and was replaced by the drawing teacher, {{ill|Giovannino von Huth|da}}. That same year, Pacht started the "Skandinavisk Panoptikon", a combination [[wax museum]] and [[cabinet of curiosities]].<ref name="V">[http://www.victorian-cinema.net/pacht Vilhelm Pacht] @ Victorian Cinema.</ref>
In 1887, he opened a factory that produced [[Intaglio (printmaking)|intaglio]] ink and [[Oil paint#Paint tubes|paint tubes]]. In 1890, the company went public as an [[aktieselskab]] called the "Danske Bogtrykkeres Farvefabrik", but he continued as General Manager.<ref name="D" /> In 1896, he presented the first moving pictures in Denmark in a wooden structure called the "Panorama" at the square in front of Copenhagen's city hall. His building and equipment were lost to a suspicious fire, but he soon re-established his shows (renamed the "Kineoptikon") at his Panoptikon.<ref name="V" />
His activities made him a wealthy man, but also ensured that his output as a painter was rather small.<ref name="K">[https://www.kulturarv.dk/kid/VisKunstner.do?kunstnerId=2674 Biographical notes] @ Kunstindeks Danmark.</ref> Just before his death in 1912, he and his second wife, Oline, created the "Vilhelm Pachts Kunstnerboligs Legat" (Artist-Dwelling Legacy), which turned his mansion, "Pachts Bo", into housing for indigent artists.
