{{advert|date=September 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2013}} {{Use Australian English|date=December 2013}} {{Infobox company | name = Yellowfin | logo = Yellowfin_Logo_2018.png | type = [[Private company|Private]] | industry = [[Software|Computer software]]
[[Business intelligence]]
[[Analytics]] | founder = Glen Rabie and Justin Hewitt | area_served = Worldwide | key_people = Glen Rabie [CEO], Justin Hewitt [COO], Daniel Shaw-Dennis [SVP], Brad Scarf [CTO] | products = Yellowfin 8 | revenue = | num_employees = | foundation = 2003 | location = [[Melbourne]], [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]], [[Australia]] | location_city = [[Tokyo]]
[[Osaka]]
[[Idaho]]
[[London]]
[[Sydney]]
[[South Africa]]
[[Brazil]] | homepage = [http://www.yellowfinbi.com/ www.yellowfinbi.com] }} '''Yellowfin''' is an Australian-headquartered [[business intelligence]] (BI), analytics, [[dashboard]] and [[report]]ing software vendor. It develops and markets a suite of products that are used to transform, access, analyse and report on data held in common business sources including [[spreadsheets]], Web [[API]]s and [[database]]s. == History == Yellowfin was founded in Melbourne, Australia in 2003 by a group of business intelligence industry veterans. The company released its first product, a [[ROLAP]] (Relational OLAP) browser-based web application for a [[Software as a service|SAAS]] software vendor in 2004. This resulted in an early specialization in providing both embedded reporting capabilities to software companies as well as support for the complexities of multi-tenancy hosted environments. The product is based on an open server architecture and was developed in Java. The design provided the basis for subsequent releases to introduce additional levels of functionality. Amongst these were the development of an integrated [[location intelligence]] module (2009), a social media layer (2010), and a responsive [[Mobile business intelligence|mobile BI]] platform (2012).{{cite news |url=http://www.smh.com.au/technology/enterprise/marvels-on-your-mobile-20100322-qrb0.html |work=Sydney Morning Herald |title=Marvels on your mobile |date=March 23, 2010 |first=Lia |last=Timson}} Further innovations include the pioneering of Storyboard, a Collaboration module (2014), and Content Canvas for free-form visualizations (2016). In 2017, Yellowfin launched 7.4 with its first AI/ML capabilities for Augmented Analytics{{cite web |title=Augmented Analytics |url=https://www.gartner.com/webinar/3846165}} using machine-assisted insights, data science integration and ETL capabilities.{{cite web |title=New Era of Analytics: Combine the best of mind and machine |url=https://www.jenunderwood.com/2018/02/12/new-era-analytics-combine-mind-and-machine/ |website=Jen Underwood}} In October 2018, with the launch of Yellowfin 8 and the introduction of two additional products – Yellowfin Stories and Yellowfin Signals – the company changed its approach, releasing the platform as a suite of five packaged products. Yellowfin Signals is continuing development in the augmented analytics space, enabling a machine automated analytics product. Due to the early association with other software vendors, Yellowfin has continued to specialize in the embedded business intelligence market providing its solution as a [[White-label product|white label product]]. The company's primary business model is growth via channel sales through resellers, software partners as well as industry alliances such as [[Sybase]].[http://www.sybase.com.au/detail?id=1059730 Sybase Partnership with Yellowfin], Sybase. As a result of these partnerships Yellowfin has over 3 million end users and 27,000 clients in over 75 countries. The software is used across a broad range of industries including financial services,[http://www.istart.co.nz/index/HM20/AL210753/AR211274 iStart Paymark signs Yellowfin], Financial Services, retail,[http://www.techworld.com.au/article/256922/plumber_350_linux_desktops_bonanza_yellowfin_bi Techworld, Plumber's 350 Linux desktops bonanza for Yellowfin BI], Retail. telecommunications, logistics,[http://www.crn.com.au/Feature/214521,logistics-swings--roundabouts.aspx CRN, Logistics is getting smarter thanks to data warehousing and business intelligence], Logistics. professional services and government. == Corporate Achievements == September 2018: Yellowfin recognized in Database Trends and Applications (DBTA) magazine's annual DBTA 100: The Companies That Matter Most in
